title: 'I was told I'd be delivered from homosexuality'
description: A survivor explains how he came to deliver conversion therapy, as a consultation into banning it starts.

title: Flowers, fruit and bakes compete for best in show
description: Photographer Jim Grover explores the world of horticultural shows.

title: Why the vending machine is making a comeback
description: From milkshakes to pizzas, new vending machines are selling an expanding range of products.

title: The British twins who set up a black-founded $1bn 'unicorn'
description: Oliver and Alexander Kent-Braham built tech firm Marshmallow during their 20s - it's now worth $1bn.

title: TikTok HGV driver: 'Lorry driving is for anyone'
description: A 22-year-old HGV driver has turned to TikTok to show people it can be a "career for anyone".

title: Shogun: 'I told the prison guards I wasn't coming back'
description: The Scottish rapper told the BBC how his approach to his career evolved after his track Vulcan went viral.

title: Girls Night In: 'We formed a human chain to stop drink spikings'
description: Dozens of women took part in the demonstration in Gedling, Nottinghamshire.

title: Japan election: How the elderly keep the ruling party in power
description: As Sunday's polls approach, we look at why it is so difficult to defeat the ruling party.

title: Marshall 'Major' Taylor: The first black American world champion & his fight to the top
description: Marshall 'Major' Taylor was the first black American to become a world champion, in 1899. This is his largely forgotten story.

title: 'Agoraphobia makes you feel like a prisoner in your own home'
description: MP Simon Clarke opted out of a Downing Street Budget photograph because of agoraphobia - what does it feel like to live with it?

title: Budget 2021: Rishi Sunak's claims fact-checked
description: Checking claims about air travel, alcohol taxes, debt and low pay.

title: Budget 2021: Millions will be worse off in 2022, says IFS
description: An economic research group says many people will see their living standards fall over the next year.

title: UK boat detained by France amid fishing rights row
description: A minister says his officials are "urgently" investigating the situation surrounding the detained boat.

title: Naz Shah: Woman admits threatening Bradford MP via email
description: Sundas Alam sent the threatening messages to Bradford West Labour MP Naz Shah, a court hears.

title: Emiliano Sala: Flight organiser convicted over plane deaths
description: David Henderson found guilty of endangering safety of an aircraft in which footballer and pilot died.

title: Heavy rain sees homes flooded and travel disrupted in Cumbria
description: The Environment Agency says a "handful" of homes have been hit, with more wet weather to come.

title: Wembley park killings: Danyal Hussein jailed for life for murdering sisters
description: Danyal Hussein must serve a minimum of 35 years for murdering Nicole Smallman and Bibaa Henry.

title: Sir David Amess' pet named Westminster Dog of the Year
description: The MP, who was stabbed to death a fortnight ago, said French Bulldog Vivienne lifted his spirits.

title: Olympians among protesters blocking Fawley oil refinery
description: Sailor Laura Baldwin and gold medal canoeist Etienne Stott are protesting in a pink boat.

title: Anscombe and Basham start for Wales against New Zealand
description: Gareth Anscombe returns at fly-half after two years out and Taine Basham gets a first start as Wales name their team to face New Zealand.

title: Covid: Moscow shops and restaurants shut in partial lockdown
description: Russia closes non-essential services and sends workers home amid record Covid deaths.

title: Will mortgages become more expensive? and other Budget questions
description: Budget questions from readers on a range of topics.

title: Dinosaur tells UN 'don't choose extinction' as part of new climate campaign
description: Actor Jack Black voices 'Frankie the Dino' in new climate campaign.

title: Climate change: Major US oil companies to be quizzed in Congress
description: A US congressional hearing will examine whether oil companies misled the public about climate change.

title: Budget 2021: Rishi Sunak claims air duty changes will lower emissions
description: Labour says making flying cheaper in the UK is an "astonishing" move ahead of COP26 climate summit.

title: South Africa's De Kock sorry for not taking knee and says he is not racist
description: South Africa's Quinton de Kock apologises after refusing to take a knee against West Indies and says he is "not a racist".

title: No Squid Game Halloween costumes, New York schools say
description: The primary schools have warned parents about the Netflix series' "violent messages".

title: 'A patient dying in my ambulance triggered PTSD'
description: For Ollie Springett the pressure of working on the front line during the pandemic was too much.

title: Covid passes set to stay as Europe heads for winter
description: There have been protests but much of Europe has accepted the QR codes as a means of extending freedoms.

title: Sitting Bull: DNA confirms great-grandson's identity
description: A sample of the Native American leader's hair confirms the identity of his great-grandson.

title: Archaeological digs in new locations at Culloden Battlefield
description: National Trust for Scotland hopes the excavations will provide new insights into the battle of 1746.

title: Lutalo Muhammad: How my grandparents’ sacrifice forged my Olympic medals
description: Two-time Olympic medallist Lutalo Muhammad takes us back to his grandparents' arrival in the UK from Jamaica, to explain how their sacrifice and his dad's influences led to him becoming one of the world's best taekwondo athletes.

title: Cristiano Ronaldo: Are Man Utd being helped or hindered by Portugal legend?
description: Cristiano Ronaldo has scored important goals already for Manchester United but they are not playing well. Is he helping or hindering them?

title: BBC Women's Footballer of the Year 2021 shortlist revealed - vote for your favourite
description: The shortlist for the BBC Women's Footballer of the Year 2021 is revealed - and you can vote for your favourite.

title: Women's Footballer of the Year contender Vivianne Miedema
description: BBC Sport profiles the Netherlands and Arsenal striker Vivianne Miedema, one of five nominees for the BBC Women's Footballer of the Year 2021 award.

title: The Papers: Sunak's spending spree and 'the Bankers' Budget'
description: Reaction to Rishi Sunak's Budget leads all but one of Thursday's front pages.

title: 'You have to prove your faith when you're dating as a black Muslim'
description: Radio 1 Newsbeat speaks to black Muslims about their experiences in the dating world and society.
